datasetDOI.cite: Kjonigsen, L.J., Lillehaug, S., Bjaalie, J.G., Witter, M.P., Leergaard, T.B., 2015. Waxholm Space atlas of the rat brain hippocampal region: three-dimensional delineations based on magnetic resonance and diffusion tensor imaging. Neuroimage 108, 441–449.

project: Waxholm Space atlas of the Sprague Dawley rat brain
description:
Anatomical delineations of 79 brain regions and white matter tracts in the Sprague Dawley rat brain, based on observations in a high resolution magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) volume (DOI: [10.25493/DTSG-ZBS](https://doi.org/10.25493/DTSG-ZBS)). 

Version 2 of the Waxholm Space atlas of the Sprague Dawley rat brain contains 13 new and updated delineations of the hippocampal formation and parahippocampal region, and 66 structure delineations unchanged relative to v1.01. 

This dataset is hosted on [NITRC.org](https://www.nitrc.org/frs/?group_id=1081) and includes: 
* [WHS\_SD\_rat\_atlas\_v2.nii.gz](https://www.nitrc.org/frs/download.php/9438/WHS_SD_rat_atlas_v2.nii.gz): delineation file with anatomical structures
* [WHS\_SD\_rat\_atlas\_v2.label](https://www.nitrc.org/frs/download.php/9439/WHS_SD_rat_atlas_v2.label): text file naming anatomical structures  
* [MBAT\_WHS\_SD\_rat\_atlas\_v2.zip](https://www.nitrc.org/frs/download.php/9440/MBAT_WHS_SD_rat_atlas_v2.zip): file describing a suggested hierarchy of the anatomical structures

**How to cite:** 
Please refer to the atlas by its RRID: SCR_017124, and cite the first publication (Papp et al., 2014) along with the publication for the atlas version you have used (see Related publications below).

Note: The licence was changed to from CC BY-SA-NC to CC BY-SA on October 1, 2021.
